channel.title: My posts on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in My posts on My New Hugo Site

item.title: To Become Lazy
item.description: There was a story that Bill Gates personally prefer lazy people for important jobs at Microsoft because they can give brilliant solutions. As humorous as it is, there is a reliable lesson that we can learn from it. In any kind of work, “make it a habit” is one way to improve efficiency. It reduces the “unnecessary” thinking part that decelerates the decision making. It also increases the synchronization of body parts.

item.title: Disciplines of Web Developing
item.description: From my experience working on Web, there are four elements of building web: Databases management, Back end services, front end functionality and front end designer. To be a competent developer, one must cover all of those fields; to be a successful developer, on must cover all of those fields and have deep knowledge in one of them.

item.title: Hello Hugo
item.description: Finally, I got myself a personal blog/website using Hugo Framework. It’s been a little bit time consuming to set up, but oh boy isn’t it look nice. I’ve always wanted to have a personal blog, but not until recently, I realized that I truly want to have a blog. Last year, I made a website for the sole purpose of getting to the employer’s eyes and it didn’t get me far.
